text: Bugsy Malone is a British criminal comedy musical movie from 1976. It was directed by Alan Parker. It is set in 1929 in New York City. The story is very loosely based on events in New York City from the early 1920s to 1931 in the Prohibition Era. It is about gangsters like Al Capone and Bugs Moran. The movie feature only child actors. The singing voices are provided by adults. It was aimed at an audience of children. Jodie Foster and Scott Baio acted in the movie. Bugsy Malone was released by Fox-Rank Distributors in the United Kingdom and Paramount Pictures in the United States. == Other websites == * Category:1976 comedy movies Category:1976 crime movies Category:1970s criminal comedy movies Category:1970s musical movies Category:British criminal comedy movies Category:British family movies Category:British musical movies Category:1970s English-language movies Category:Gangster movies Category:Movies set in New York City Category:Movies set in the 1920s Category:Movies directed by Alan Parker Category:Movies about children Category:Movies about organized crime in the United States Category:Paramount Pictures movies Category:Multilingual movies Category:Movies about alcohol
title: Bugsy Malone
